DataElement.preferredName: Tissue Biospecimen Liquid Nitrogen Freezing Date/Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates the date and time that a biospecimen transitioned from a liquid to a solid matter phase using liquid nitrogen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius._The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to about -200 degrees Celsius.:The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase.

Concepts.definition: Nitrogen in a liquid state, having been super-cooled to -196 degrees Celsius.
The act or event which causes the transition from a liquid to solid matter phase when the temperature is lowered.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Display format: MM/DD/YYYY HR:MN; Use NCIt based Rep Class
